author: J R
text: 'Been a few times and loved it so much I did a private birthday event here. Truly one of the best restaurants on all levels; The food
column5: the service
column6: the ambiance
column7: the attention to detail...all is top notch. Highly recommend for a date
column10: I‚Äôve done em all and will do it again. A prime example of a perfect hospitality establishment.'

author: Michael Gebo
text: 'Excellent restaurant! Certainly a top 2 or 3 in Hoboken. Went with another couple and sampled several appetizers and we each had different entrees. All of the dishes were flavorful and delicious. Everything has a healthy bent to it. They have done a really nice job on the design/atmosphere and friendly
column5: attentive service. Going to be our go to restaurant!'

author: High Virtue
text: 'Great service from Elvin.'

author: Carlos Enrique Caro mill√°n
text: 'Muy acogedor y muy recomendables las cervezas artesanales..volver√©'

author: March√°nt Davis
text: 'By far the best Restaurant in Hoboken! Get the Lamb and you can thank me later!'

author: N Busch
text: 'We had such a wonderful first meal at Olivia‚Äôs. Our outdoor table was comfortable
column5: the waitstaff was excellent. Everything we ordered was delicious and beautifully plated. I tried the Hoboken Life cocktail which was delicious. The guacamole and fried artichoke hearts were both tasty appetizers. For mains we had the steak
column6: lobster & shrimp spaghettini and vegan bolognese. Everything was so good! The green beans and mashed potatoes were excellent. We shared the passion fruit tart and guava ice cream - beautiful
column7: natural flavors without being heavy or overly sweet. We can‚Äôt wait to return and try more dishes.'

author: Amir Zeenreich
text: "Let me start by addressing what would probably be the main complaint by future reviews - the price.\n\nIf you're looking for a 'bang for your buck' type of experience
column5: there are other restaurants in Hoboken that can offer that.\nHowever
column6: if you're looking for high end dining that doesn't fall short in quality and creativity (and yes
column7: prices) than the best restaurants in Manhattan - this is the place for you.\n\nMy wife and I had 3 starters (fried artichoke
column8: filet mignon tacos and the mushrooms and eggplant balls) and we would have eaten the plates
column9: if these were edible. Everything was simply DELICIOUS!! The portions are not very big but but also not tiny that you feel you've gotten the short end of the stick.\n\nThe cocktails are also on the high end of the scale price wise
column10: but they're very big. We've had the red sangria and the Unrequited Love and they were both great (mind you
column11: they're also very strong).\n\nI'm taking one star off for being seated next to the kitchen and for the horrible acoustics that made me scream all night to wife. But I was mostly screaming that I love this place and that we'll definitely be coming back!"

author: TJ xenos
text: 'Fantastic food. Great vibe'

author: Michaela Keil
text: 'Great for brunch'

author: Michael Perdomo
text: 'One of my favorites in Hoboken.  Food was delicious
column5: and really good cocktails.  Servers are very friendly.  Nice outdoor setup as well'

author: Jay Sosa
text: 'Lamb chops are a must have!'

author: Ayush Mohanty
text: 'We were 7 minutes late and they gave up the table. Extremely disappointed that the hostess was rude about it. We made these reservations weeks ahead of time.'

author: Mark Hansen
text: "The food was super delicious! Absolutely loved our appetizer and main courses. The cocktails were also well made and used high-quality alcohol. The inside seating was quite tight unfortunately
column5: it kind of felt like we were on a double date with the couple next to us. Worth a visit (we would go again!)
column6: especially if you can go at a time that isn't too busy."

author: Patricia Reid
text: 'This place is a joke!  Booked a reservation at 515 a week ago and specifically asked to eat indoors. They kept telling me that they would do their best to accommodate us when I kept saying that my husband could not eat outdoors. It was supposed to be my birthday dinner but I was getting extremely anxious that they would not seat us indoors. Thank God Manhattan is so close.  This place has growing pains. Been to the finest restaurants and have no patience for this.'

author: MG Gro
text: 'Oh yummy! Had chicken
column5: shrimp and pasta. And some sharables ( fish spread).  Sat outside and enjoyed the warm night.  The food was absolutely fabulous.  The water was extremely helpful
column6: patient and friendly.'

author: Danielle LeBeau
text: 'Do not come here if you have any food allergies
column5: it is not safe. My husband and I sat down for drinks and clearly told the wait staff that I have an allergy
column6: not just a dislike
column7: and to please confirm if these menu items are safe. Without hesitation we were told yes and food was ordered. I was definitely skeptical at this point because the answer came with a confused look on the waiters face... After putting the food down
column8: we confirmed it was dairy free but I still asked what was in the sauce. The waiter left the table and came back to tell us that "yes" there was an allergen in the sauce. blown away how careless this was... this is not ok and so disappointed.'

author: Osvaldo Valdes
text: 'Nice date night spot but can get a little loud inside. It was a Thursday night but overall the food was great although a bit overpriced.'

author: Kenneth Cardona
text: 'Great experience for dinner for two. Had the sea bass and porterhouse special. Drinks were fantastic and service was on point.'

author: Herve Grosse
text: 'A gem in the neighborhood. Good cocktails. Creative dishes. Cannot wait to come back.'

author: Justine Schepis
text: 'One of the best restaurants in Hoboken. Our food was great and the presentation was also. We had guacamole (amazing!)
column5: steak tacos (amazing!) and the flat iron steak (amazing!-the manchego mashed potatoes were the best mashed potatoes I‚Äôve ever had). Our server Milton B was excellent! Very knowledgeable of the menu-food and drink. He gave us great recommendations! We had a great evening!'

author: Alexandra Henriques
text: 'Amazing meal and ambiance! The duck tacos were great
column5: and so was the lobster pasta.'

author: Arnaud Tinet
text: 'Good service. Shrimp a la plancha should be revisited
column5: cooked differently.  The Coconut flan was delicious.'

author: Maribel Gonzalez
text: 'I simply loved the place
column5: the food and the service. I will definitely go back.'

author: Kyrsten Musich
text: 'Great food. Interesting twist on different dishes'

author: Danielle Rutigliano
text: 'Went today for the first time and I thought is was meh both in service and food relative to other restaurants in the area
column5: especially given the price tag. Not unique enough of a menu nor in its execution so sadly would not recommend. Did not enjoy my drinks either sadly'

author: Hiral Trivedi
text: 'Went for my birthday and had the worst experience ever. When I got there I told the host I asked for outside sitting and she kept arguing with me that you never asked for it. After checking her chart
column5: she agreed that it was outside sitting. Now
column6: I had no table for almost half an hour of waiting. Host said she needs to set up the table for us. Once table was set up she told me table is crampy for a party of 5. No rule following of 6 feet between tables. Felt like they were doing me favor giving us a table. No service or hospitality at all. I felt very unwelcome and unwanted. Heard so much about this place but will never recommend anyone to go there. Their business is running because of patrons like us. Ultimately
column7: I declined the crampy table and headed out somewhere else. Olivia
column8: step up your hospitality and get rid of your attitude.'

author: Claudia Deriy
text: 'Food was delicious. Ambiance was great. Drinks were the best.'

author: Denise Foster
text:
'Good food. I had the Spaghettini which was quite tasty although the lobster was a little chewy. My waiter was very attentive and provided very good service.

I gave it 4 stars because the hostess was rude and inpatient.  I went there yesterday Sat 7/31 on a whim. She wanted to seat me inside but with the AC full blast it was chilly.

So I asked if there was anything available outside.

There are two tables that are almost on the street I didn‚Äôt want to sit there.  So I asked again if there was anything else outside.

She said no everything has reservations.

I went early on purpose .. 5:30.  Then I spotted a table by a nice corner and asked if that was ok.

She said yea you can sit there and threw the menus snd left.

With the prices they charge their hostess needs to be on point.

I will go back as I live right on the block and as I mentioned the food snd waiter service was pretty good'

author: Antoine Tessier
text: 'Wanna be Manhattan restaurant
column5: very loud. Food is ok nothing fantastic. Price is high for what you get.'

author: Scott Clarke
text: 'I‚Äôve only ever written one review before and it was exceedingly positive
column5: so I hope that shows how strongly my wife and I felt about this experience. I‚Äôm shocked to see all these five star reviews on here
column6: because our anniversary dinner was absolutely horrible.\n\nThe first thing you notice is it is far too loud in there. Mind you
column7: we‚Äôre young people so this is typically not something we comment on
column9: packing tables into the small space
column11: you‚Äôll end up struggling to hear someone screaming across the table from you.\n\nShockingly
column12: the restaurant seems over-staffed. There must have been 20 employees in the dining area. Even with this
column13: the service was horrible. While our server was very very nice
column14: it was clear he didn‚Äôt know what he was doing. We ordered drinks
column15: then he came back before they arrived to take food orders. After the decent drinks arrived
column16: he took our order. We ordered appetizers and entrees. The apps arrived and were nothing special. My wife loved a chip that came with the Mediterranean spread (which is actually just a small jar of whitefish salad and olives)
column17: so I guess that‚Äôs something.\n\nAfter a long wait with empty drinks and waters
column20: asking about entrees. He clearly forgot to put them in. He seemed confused when we ordered a second round of drinks. At that point
column21: he must have put our entree orders in
column22: not that he ever said anything or apologized. After an extremely long wait (we had our phones out looking for availabilities at other restaurants) the exceedingly underwhelming entrees arrived. Bland would be an overstatement. We ate what we could and asked for the check. This was the first time we got prompt service all night as the waiter brought the check over immediately. We brought home the sides; maybe our two year old will like them.\n\nWe are very tolerant of growing pains for new restaurants
column25: and blah food are just inexcusable. Sadly Olivia‚Äôs didn‚Äôt just fail to become a new local favorite (we live just down the street)
column26: but in almost 8 years of living in Hoboken
column29: may have been the worst dining experience we‚Äôve ever had.'

author: Tom Koty
text: 'Meh. Good food but hard to enjoy a luke warm steak. Slow service
column5: disengaged server. Basically
column6: he took our orders
column7: then didn\'t return again until we asked for the check. No dessert or coffee offered. Took an early reservation because it was booked solid
column8:
then the restaurant opened 15 minutes late?

Gave it a 2 because:
A) Not a single aspect of our meal or service that made us go
column9:
"Wow! That was cool/unique/fun/delicious." (We're not that hard to impress and make happy).

B) I've had worse experiences and food.

If I could break it down:
Food - 2.5 stars
Ambiance - 4 stars (cool space)
Service - 1 star'

author: Kimberly Hill
text: 'I have had salmon probably over 200 times
column5: and this was the best I have ever had. Great ambiance
column6: service

author: Jonathan Liebman
text: 'First time patron.  Service and Staff were excellent as was our meal.\nDefinitely will be back.'

author: Jade Briggs
text: "Me and my family had Olivia's for my birthday and I decided to get the grilled lamb. It was amazing! It was seasoned and cooked to perfection. My kids enjoyed the crispy shrimp with a side of fries and my daughter had the chicken strips and fries. The chicken strips and fries were a very large portion for kids she was able to save some for the next day. I called in a few days later to place a carry out order for the lamb but was disappointed to find out they don't do carry out orders."

author: Anat Klein
text: 'Food was great and so is the service. The only downside is that indoor seating is so loud that you will have to scream'

author: JuliJu
text: "Great expirence you're  not only going through the Mediterranean
column5: you will go around the world. The service was great and food delicious
column6: I will recommend this place. You should start with Mediterranean  spread ü§§
column7: Tuna ceviche a must. Cocktails Hb life and The B.O.M. üëçüëçüëçüëç"

author: Antonio Fisch
text: 'Food was amazing and the best part it‚Äôs close to home . Great customer service and actually listens to customers request . I have to say I‚Äôll be coming here often . I don‚Äôt usually review but since I opened my account this was one of the restaurants I needed to review ASAP'

author: Millie Jenkins
text: 'Highly recommend checking this place out
column5: will not disappoint.'

author: Robert Lurie
text: 'Really incredible. Cocktails are simple but really good and refreshing. May not think of guacamole when thinking Mediterranean
column5: but guacamole is really good. I the skirt steak and my wife got the pork chops and both were incredible. They gave us a passion fruit tart to finish the meal and it was fantastic.\n\nOverall
column6: great addition to the area. Service was quick but not overbearing. Great outdoor seating
column7: and indoors look nice. Brunch service will be starting soon
column8: looking forward to be back for dinner and brunch.'

author: Alexandra Schwab
text: 'Very friendly service! The staff were very accommodating when we came for drinks at a busy time. The cocktails are excellent
column5: especially the ‚ÄúDown for the BOM‚Äù.'

author: Alessandro Cardito
text: 'Another gem in Hoboken! Food was very wel prepared - cocktails were good and atmosphere is among the best...great music!'

author: Monica Mantilla
text: 'We LOVE this restaurant! We visited Olivia for the grand opening with my 5 year old ("Olivia") who has been anxiously waiting for the opening of this restaurant for months. She brought her Olivia book and both the chef and owner signed it! We took pictures and she was very happy! The moment was priceless. In addition
column5: the food was AMAZING! The ceviche and the churrasco are outstanding
column6: drinks are great and the dessert is delicious!  Our compliments to the Chef who has such a talent! We look forward to visiting this restaurant many times!'

author: Natalie Robertson
text: 'Great atmosphere
column5: good food
column6: nice staff. A cute place for dinner with girlfriends or a date with someone you have a little crush on.'

author: maria jesus sievers
text: 'Great ambience
column5: drinks and food. A bit pricey'

author: Ariadne Reza
text: "Olivia's was amazing! The churrasco was delicious. Drinks were perfect too! Definitely somewhere to go if you're looking for a special place."

author: Mehnt Bhatia
text: 'They need a server or 2 more as service was on the slow side. But the food and especially the cocktails were fantastic.'

author: Ruke Loshaj
text: 'Went out for dinner here with my brother and his girlfriend this past Saturday and OH MY GOD! It was AMAZING! Everyone from the host to our waiter were so nice. The waiter answered any questions we had about the menu and continuously checked on us through out the night. We got the guca
column5: croquettes
column6: and grilled octopus for starters and they were pack full of flavor! We also got the salmon and steak for our entr√©es and once again did not disappoint. Cooked perfectly and decent portions. And their cocktails were on point! Lastly we got dessert and that was the cherry on top with the tres leches and lemon tart. Highly recommend checking this place out
column7: will not disappoint.\n\nThe ambience inside was great and they had live music from a talented singer! Just added to the overall vibe.'

author: Jonathan Pepe
text: "Olivia's is a breath of fresh air in town. It's a cute space with trendy touches. The staff are great and very warm. The latin fusion cuisine is all well prepared
column5: presented
column6: and most importantly...tasty! Cocktails were on point as well. Fried artichokes were great
column7: as was the 3 bean hummus. We'd recommend them both
column8: although the sauce accompanying the artichokes was addictively good. Patrice's chicken was a gorgeous presentation and preparation. My churrasco was top notch though the plating was a bit slapdash. We wrapped with a lovely lemon tart which was surprisingly elegant. The espressos that accompanied did the job but they weren't a highlight. Wine list is to-the-point and has plenty of accessible options. Overall 4 stars
column9: quickly rising to 5 I hope. We will definitely be back."

author: Elisa I
text: 'Great atmosphere
column5: food was delicious. Cocktails were a little pricey for what we got
column6: would probably go with wine instead next time. Definitely would go back.'

author: Mike Mariniello
text: 'Great new spot.  Amazing food and a great addition to the neighborhood'

author: Lisa Hanuka
text: 'Nice place
column5: food was good
column6: not amazing and very heavy.'

author: Luis Hormigo
text: 'Excellent restaurant
column5: excellent service
column6: excellent choice! üëè'

author: Hila Niv
text: 'Highly recommend! Amazing good and outstanding service at this new Hoboken gem!'

author: mike byrd
text: 'Went there to celebrate my anniversary with wife and friends. Absolutely worth the trip from 1.5 hour drive. Everything was so delicious. From the goat cheese guacamole
column5: to every single appetizer
column6: which we tried. Was so amazingly good. We tried most everything on the menu . I can say it was all delicious. The food was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The drinks
column8: even the coffee were prepared perfectly.  Some of the dishes were inspired by French cuisine. We had friends that were GFree and they loved the variety of tasty Gfree dishes. The interior of the restaurant was taste fully designed. This will be a must try for all and our new Favorite place'

author: Myrna Byrd
text: 'The Best Food in Hoboken. Celebrity Chef Ricardo Cardona brings his magic to New Jersey.  Highly recommend this establishment as the new IT place in Hoboken.'

author: Stephen Snider
text: 'Went to tonights "soft" opening....clearly they were figuring out things on the first night....quite expected.  That said - Food was fabulous!!! Atmosphere really nice.  Great addition to north end of town.  Will become a neighborhood favorite.'
